description: Ebola virus entry requires the cholesterol transporter Niemann-Pick C1: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3175325/
summary: NPC1 a cholesterol transporter in cell is necessary for  Ebola virus infection. NPC1 has specific entry site for cleaved ebola virus glycoprotein and this fusion is essential to accomplish late phase of infection. A dummy/decoy receptor can be bioengineered from the structure of the entry point on NPC1 which should attach with cleaved envelop glycoprotein without triggering a cascade response. This decoy receptor can be used as a drug that will bind Ebola virus envelope glycoprotein during latent phase of infection. Ebola virus entry requires the cholesterol transporter Niemann-Pick C1: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3175325/
title: Bioengineer decoy receptor for Ebola virus envelope glycoprotein  to stop infection
